result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean Allen Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dean Allen Johnson

records.addlTxt: DEF agrees to move forward, with no information filed.  State to file information, exact to criminal complaint.   Atty acknowledged receipt of information.  Moves to Plea/Sentencing.

Atty Gill indicates DEF  waives prelim.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.

1:47 PM Defendant Dean Allen Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Dean Allen Johnson.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court addresses the DEF on attorney appearing by video, DEF agrees to proceed.   State recites agreement, all parties agree.   Court moves to waiver of preliminary hearing and arraignment.   Court reviews the information being filed by State,  DEF enters NC Plea to Count 1.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds DEF guilty to Count 1.   Counts 2, 3, 4 are dismissed and read in.   State makes statement prior to statement, request to follow proposal.  Attny Gill makes statement prior to sentencing.  DEF makes statement to court.  Court has discussion with DEF.   Court to follow agreement.  

COURT:  withheld sentence.  3 years probation.  Conditions of Probation:  Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.  AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  Absolute Sobriety.  Court Costs.  DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.   Consecutive to 22CF117.   If revoked,  10 days County Jail credit
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 21, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
